repnme.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Basic Education
            Expansion Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Basic Education
            Expansion Project for Republic of Yemen were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: strong focus on a single development objective is
            instrumental in achieving substantial changes in development
            trends. In keeping a clear focus on girls basic education in
            rural areas, the project not only surpassed its original
            development objectives in the target governorates, but also
            catalyzed additional support to basic education at the
            national level from the government, local communities and
            donors. Simple and flexible implementation arrangements with
            an emphasis on strengthening the capacity of government
            agencies proved to be effective in achieving project goals,
            and ensuring ownership. In a context of weak capacity,
            flexible implementation plans allow for corrective measures
            with a main focus on achieving development objectives.
            Community involvement in the definition of educational needs
            is critical to ensure girls enrolment. Community
            participation in the school site selection and construction
            contributed to developing ownership. Community Participation
            Unit (CPU) work with communities was instrumental in raising
            awareness and mobilizing communities for girls education.

5081741.trustfund:
TF029658-PHRD-EDUC. MGMT. &
            ADMINISTRATION REFORM PROJ.,TF035698-MENA REGION - SECTOR STRATEGY
            FOR EDUCATION,TF022166-BNPP-POVERTY : SEED MONEY FOR
            MENA WORK PROGRAM,TF025466-PHRD-UPGRADING REGIONAL
            STATISTICS ON EDUCATION,TF029508-PHRD-EDUCATION QUALITY
            ENHANCEMENT PROGRAM

abstracts.cdata!:
The Basic Education Expansion Project,
            supports the education sector strategy in Yemen, providing
            basic education, through improved education quality. The
            components will: 1) expand access to education, by
            increasing the number of schools, through construction, and
            rehabilitation of schools, in an efficient, and demand-based
            selection of school sites, using school mapping databases,
            and community participation. Funding for management capacity
            building will be provided for the Ministry of Education
            (MOE), as well as for implementation of cost-effective
            maintenance, and repair methods; 2) improve the quality of
            education in rural basic schools, through in-service teacher
            training, and, training for inspectors, and, headmasters.
            Reforms in teacher deployment will be performed to enhance
            interventions, and, a new curriculum will be introduced.
            Educational materials, and school furniture will be supplied
            upon completion of civil works; and, 3) strengthen the
            capacity of the MOE, to implement basic education reforms,
            and to prepare educational statistics, and monitoring.
            Quality programs will be implemented, and, project
            management will be strengthened in terms of regulatory
            framework, business guidelines, and information management.
            Technical assistance will be provided to develop action
            plans for community participation activities.

repnme.cdata!:
Yemen - Basic Education Expansion Project :
            environmental management plan

abstracts.cdata!:
Although major negative environmental
            impacts are not anticipated as a result of the Education
            Sector Management Reform Project, minor environmental issues
            are expected as a result of the construction, and
            rehabilitation of small rural schools, to be monitored, and
            mitigated, specifically, through the processes of: site
            selection; standard design, and specifications; and,
            construction; the three, included under the project's
            Expansion of Access Component. This environmental management
            plan (EMP) addresses the processes criteria, and outlines
            the following mitigation plan. Sites selection would avoid
            natural vegetation areas, as well as flooding, and/or
            earthquake prone sites. The standard school designs address
            sanitation in particular, to include toilets, and
            appropriate sanitary measures. Furthermore, the use of
            asbestos would be barred, and, although the current scale of
            asbestos use is unknown, existing buildings will be surveyed
            in accordance with applicable laws for safety, and
            environmental risks. Construction contracts would be
            supervised by site engineers, to ensure adequate disposal of
            debris, including toxic residues, oil spillage, and
            hazardous chemicals. Existing lead-based paints will be
            handled in an environmentally safe manner, and, in the
            future, the use of lead-based paints will be discontinued.
            Public awareness campaigns will address health, and hygiene issues.
